Link Mash (July 24, 2014)

Jul 24, 2014
1 minute read

The weekly Link Mash is a curated selection of tools, stories, and other links that I found during my travels on the web. All of my links can be found on my Pinboard; you can also find the Link Mash archives here.

  • Holy crap, check out the awesome new Lego Batman Tumbler! YES PLEASE.
  • Input Tags. Another document gem from Launch Center Pro, this time detailing all the options that can be attached to prompts.
  • 2.3.1 Release Notes (Parsing Changes). I recently ran into a situation where Launch Center Pro was having issues with multi-word queries in Wikipanion; turns out I needed to manually encode it again. This changelog page ended up being a gold mine of this and other solid info.
  • CoRD: Remote Desktop for Mac OS X. The Microsoft Remote Desktop client isn’t good at all. This is a great alternative with nice additional features.
  • 21 Times People From Colorado Should’ve Known Better. Amen to this, folks.
  • A P R I L Z E R O. A great read on how an impressive site design came into existence. I love this stuff.
  • #190: Everything but a Business Model – Developing Perspective. A great podcast that outlines the different models for income in an App Store environment.

This Link Mash was generated by PinPress, a simple tool to generate text templates from Pinboard data.
